questions.question: Input the identity matrix of size 2x2 using the matrix input feature.
Write the first four terms of the sequence defined by \( a_k = \frac{3k}{k + 2} \) for integers \( k \geq 1 \).
Using the logical input, evaluate the expression \( (p \lor q) \land \neg r \) when \( p = true \), \( q = false \), and \( r = true \).
Using the calculator keyboard, input the result of \( 7 + 5 \times 3 \).
Determine if the expression \( p \lor \neg p \) is a tautology (always true). Answer 'true' or 'false'.
Calculate the binomial coefficient \( \binom{6}{2} \) using the LaTeX input.
If matrix \( B = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -1 \\ 3 & 4 \end{bmatrix} \), input the result of multiplying B by 3.
Enter the negation of the statement: 'All students are enrolled in a math class.'
questions.answer: Not all students are enrolled in a math class.

questions.question: Write the sum of the first 5 positive integers.
Evaluate the predicate \( Q(x): x^2 < 10 \) for \( x = 2 \). Answer 'true' or 'false'.
Use the discrete math keyboard to simplify the expression \( (p \land q) \lor (p \land \neg q) \).
Find the explicit formula for the sequence with terms: 2, 5, 10, 17, 26.
